casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee v. Colby Ross THURMAN, Defendant-Appellant. No. 06-10965

Conference Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Oct. 25, 2007. Roger L. McRoberts, U.S. Attorney’s Office, Northern District of Texas, Lubbock, TX, for Plaintiff-Appellee. David E. Sloan, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Northern District of Texas, Lubbock, TX, for Defendant-Appellant. Before JOLLY, BENAVIDES, and STEWART, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM:*

The Federal Public Defender appointed to represent Colby Ross Thurman has moved for leave to withdraw and has filed a brief in accordance with Anders v. California, 386 U.S. 738, 87 S.Ct. 1396, 18 L.Ed.2d 493 (1967). Thurman has not filed a response. Our independent review of the record and counsel’s brief discloses no nonfrivolous issue for appeal. Accordingly, counsel’s motion for leave to withdraw is GRANTED, counsel is excused from further responsibilities herein, and *949the APPEAL IS DISMISSED. See 5th Cir. R. 42.2.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except tmder the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
